body:
If you’ve made a decision about your child arrangements with the other person (the respondent) you can ask the court to make it legally binding.

This is known as a consent order.

You can only ask for a consent order if:

- you have your agreement in writing (you’ll need to attach the agreement to your application)
- you’re not in dispute with the other person
- the court has no concerns about the safety or welfare of anyone involved

(i)  This question only applies to any new agreement. Don’t include any previous agreements or orders the court may have made.
